title: Bukayo Saka ready to challenge Alexandre Lacazette for starting spot in Arsenal's attack
text:
Bukayo Saka, Arsenal’s teenage winger, has said he is ready to challenge Alexandre Lacazette for a place in Unai Emery’s attack as the Frenchman prepares to make his long-awaited return against Sheffield United on Monday night.

Lacazette, Arsenal’s player of the year last season, has missed the last seven games because of an ankle injury he first suffered during pre-season.

In Lacazette’s absence Saka has started Arsenal’s last three Premier League matches, impressing in a left-wing position. The 18-year-old said he believes he has now shown that Emery can trust him to be a regular starter for the first team.

Asked if he feels ready to go head-to-head with Lacazette for a place in the Arsenal side, Saka said: “Yeah. It is always good to have all our best players available, all of us competing makes us push to play better and better.

“If one player is injured then others get an opportunity but I want everyone to come back and do the best for Arsenal. The boss knows what I can do, what the other players can do.
description: Bukayo Saka, Arsenal’s teenage winger, has said he is ready to challenge Alexandre Lacazette for a place in Unai Emery’s attack as the Frenchman prepares to make his long-awaited return against Sheffield United on Monday night.
